channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Brown University shooting suspect found dead. And Epstein files release deadline looms
item.description: The man suspected of fatally shooting two students at Brown University has been found dead. And, today is the Justice Department's deadline to release files on Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
The man suspected of fatally shooting two students at Brown University has been found dead. And, today is the Justice Department's deadline to release files on Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: It's the last news quiz of the year! Will you go out on top?
item.description: This week, we've got annoying holiday movies, chatty White House insiders, and cheese.
item.content:encoded: This week, we've got annoying holiday movies, chatty White House insiders, and cheese.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Trump will revisit a North Carolina town, now the focus of a newly redrawn congressional district
item.description: While he is directly appealing to Americans that the economy is improving, President Trump will visit a congressional district Republicans are eyeing in their attempts to keep control the U.S. House.
item.content:encoded:
While he is directly appealing to Americans that the economy is improving, President Trump will visit a congressional district Republicans are eyeing in their attempts to keep control the U.S. House.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Adam Wagner

item.title: COMIC: 6 tips to help you overcome social anxiety this season
item.description: If you're tempted to bail on potentially fun events becuase you feel awkward, read this. Level up your small talk game and practice social courage with six tips from psychologists.
item.content:encoded: If you're tempted to bail on potentially fun events becuase you feel awkward, read this. Level up your small talk game and practice social courage with six tips from psychologists.
item.dc:creator: Shay Mirk

item.title: In the shadow of U.S. export controls, China rallies its own chip industry
item.description: The chip industry in China is hustling to overcome a Western tech choke hold, even as President Trump appears poised to loosen U.S. chip restrictions.
item.content:encoded:
The chip industry in China is hustling to overcome a Western tech choke hold, even as President Trump appears poised to loosen U.S. chip restrictions.

(Image credit: John Ruwitch/NPR)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Meet the new WaPo food critic who won't dine in anonymity
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel tags along for lunch with Elazar Sontag, the Washington Post's new food critic.
item.content:encoded:
Morning Edition about ending anonymity and rethinking how restaurant criticism can feel more accessible.'/>

NPR's Leila Fadel tags along for lunch with Elazar Sontag, the Washington Post's new food critic.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: What to watch for in this weekend's College Football Playoff first round
item.description: An unpredictable and exciting college football season is coming to a close. This weekend's first-round slate is set up for two tight games and two blowouts — but in the playoffs, anything goes.
item.content:encoded:
An unpredictable and exciting college football season is coming to a close. This weekend's first-round slate is set up for two tight games and two blowouts — but in the playoffs, anything goes.

(Image credit: (From left to right) Michael Reaves/Getty Images; Chris Bernacchi/Diamond Images via Getty Images; Joe Buvid/ISI Photos via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Friday is the deadline to release the Epstein files. Here's what to expect
item.description: Friday is the deadline for the government to release files related to the life and death of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. There are still questions about what will be published and when.
item.content:encoded:
Friday is the deadline for the government to release files related to the life and death of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. There are still questions about what will be published and when.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Man shares how 'making Christmas' helped him connect with his roots
item.description: Dr. J. Herman Blake shares how celebrating Christmas on the South Carolina sea islands brought him closer to his African roots.
item.content:encoded: Dr. J. Herman Blake shares how celebrating Christmas on the South Carolina sea islands brought him closer to his African roots.
item.dc:creator: Max Jungreis

item.title: Trump suspends U.S. green card lottery after Brown University and MIT shootings
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said in a post on the social platform X that, at Trump's direction, she is ordering the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services to pause the program.
item.content:encoded:
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said in a post on the social platform X that, at Trump's direction, she is ordering the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services to pause the program.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
